He uses the opportunity to engage in score-settling, pinning blame on others for the biggest foreign policy debacle in decades. In his worldview, the news media and authors who recounted Bush's term in office have distorted almost everything-including the timing of the decision to go to war in Iraq after the 9/11 attacks; the responsibility for holding, interrogating and prosecuting detainees in Guantanamo Bay; and even the handling of the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina, href="http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp- dyn/content/article/2011/02/08/AR2011020800009_2.html?wprss=rss_print/bookworld&sid=ST2009061102977" target="_blank"> Gwen Ifill writes in the Washington Post.
